frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.
This  frame covers the descriptions of tastes and smells, and has one main frame element, Source.
A former Member of a Group ceases to be a member as a result of the action of an Authority within the Group.
A Self_mover intentionally moves in a Directionon a Path relative to landmark that is neither the Source nor the Goal of the overall motion.
In this frame a Source_emitter discharges its Emission along a Path or to a Goal.  ' (1)
An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).
frameExamples: I saw that several men in dark suits had <t>removed</t> all of the evidence from the scene.
The priest <t>excommunicated</t> Henry from the church.
Ambrose Powell <t>forded</t> over on one horse, and we drove the others after him.
(1) The factory <t>exudes</t> toxic fumes from three large chimneys.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
Theme is the object that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before it changes location.
The non-Agentive cause of the removing event.
The time at which the removal takes place.
The location where the removal takes place.
<fen>Perceptual_source</fen> is used for the entity that is being described. A recipe can stand in for a <fen>Perceptual_source</fen> which is a kind of food.
<fen>Sensory_attribute</fen> is used for words that describe the perception itself.
The person who used to belong to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
An empowered subset of the <fen>Group</fen> which decides to expel its former <fen>Member</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.
The Place where the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.
This is a sentient being or a vehicle steered by a sentient being which moves.
Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>.
Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, excluding directional expressions:
Any expression which indicates where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously.
The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
The <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is the item  from which the <fen>Emission</fen> are discharged.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when  the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.
The <fen>Executioner</fen> is the individual who performs the execution.
The <fen>Executed</fen> is the person who is killed by the <fen>Executioner</fen> in retribution for the crime that the <fen>Executed</fen> was convicted of.
When the execution occurs.
Where the execution takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The waiter</fex> removed the dishes from the table.
The waiter removed <fex>the dishes</fex> from the table.
The waiter removed the dishes <fex>from the table</fex>.
<fex>The raging fire</fex> quickly emptied the square of all people.
<fex>That year</fex> they drained the swamp-water out of Higgs' bottomland.
You just take the dishes and rinse them <fex>in the kitchen</fex>, okay?
The almonds had a bitter <fex> taste</fex>.
I 'm afraid that <fex>I</fex> was expelled from the Society after they found I endorsed him.
Giles bemoaned his expulsion <fex>from the Future Farmers of America</fex>
<fex>We</fex> drive down dusty roads, forded through a stream, and tried to get up a mountainside on a rocky road.
We forded <fex>from the island</fex> to the mainland.
We decided to cut <fex>through the forest</fex>.
I'll cut across the Sahara desert <fex>up to Algeria and Morocco</fex>.
We followed the trail (which is well marked with cairns) and then cut <fex>west</fex> across a grassy meadow for about 1000 feet to the crest of  the nearby saddle lying below North Peak.
The Federal Army of the Potomac forded the river <fex>in August 1862</fex>.
The common brook is best forded <fex>south of the hut</fex>.
The truth is, <fex>we</fex> have all put them to death.
<fex>He</fex> was to be hanged in the morning.
